intro: Manihot stellata, commonly known as the starleaf arrowroot, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine and as a source of starch. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
